Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 070434 ZSK, a special permit, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application nos. C 070432 ZMK and C 070433 HAK that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Cook Street Housing/Rezoning, Brooklyn (C070434ZSK)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn)
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no., C 070211 ZSM a special permit to allow an attended public parking garage at 200 11th Avenue, Manhattan, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 200 11th Avenue, Manhattan (C070211ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Lappin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 1641 Second Avenue, Application no. 20075497 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, KMG Group LLC, Manhattan (20075497TCM)

Items.Title:

Items.MatterName: NYC Department of Education to stop using products made of polystyrene foam, commonly known as Styrofoam.

Items.MatterName: Operation of material hoists.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Administration to increase Job Training Participant programs such as the Parks Opportunity Program to include additional City agencies and job titles, and to enhance the program by providing program participants 12 month positions, intensive case management services and meaningful educational and training opportunities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Administration to increase Job Training Participant programs such as the Parks Opportunity Program to include additional City agencies and job titles, and to enhance the program by providing program participants 12 month positions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and State Legislature to supplement the state’s welfare policies with a wage supplement program, which would provide cash payments on top of earnings from wages, and an increase in the earned income disregard, which would allow welfare participants with earnings to keep more of their wages.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Governor and State Legislature to supplement the state’s welfare policies with a wage supplement program.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Governor and State Legislature to adjust the current level of the non-shelter portion of the public assistance grant to match cost of living increases.

Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.6177, which is designed to reform the Brownfield Cleanup Program.

Items.MatterName: Call for the director of the State Office of Homeland Security to conduct a review and analysis of security measures in place at commercial aviation fuel distribution facilities and pipelines that are not located at commercial airports. (S.6167/A.9086)

Items.MatterName: Mayor of the City of New York to form a Strategic Public Housing Equitable Development Task Force.
